intro: Calhounia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf calhounia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Calhounia angustifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing habitat for pollinators.
